caption: Figure 3: Ablation study of CLIPScore Thresholds (a,c) & Curriculum Strategies (b,d) on ImageNet-LT and iWildCam. The error bar reports the standard deviation of each experiment.
description: The ablation study results on two classification tasks demonstrate that the selection of the CLIPScore threshold should be carefully aligned with the generation quality inherent to the task-at-hand.

caption: Figure 4: CLIP Cosine similarity score on ImageNet-LT computed between: (a) Synthetic image - original real images. (b) Synthetic image - defined text prompt.
description: The chart displays the cosine similarity scores between synthetic images and real images, as well as between synthetic images and their corresponding text prompts, across different image guidance levels.

caption: Figure 4: CLIP Cosine similarity score on ImageNet-LT computed between: (a) Synthetic image - original real images. (b) Synthetic image - defined text prompt.
description: The violin plot shows the cosine similarity scores between synthetic images and their corresponding real images or text prompts, varying across different image guidance levels.

caption: Figure 4: CLIP Cosine similarity score on ImageNet-LT computed between: (a) Synthetic image - original real images. (b) Synthetic image - defined text prompt.
description: The chart visualizes the cosine similarity scores computed using CLIP between synthetic images and both their corresponding real images and text prompts across various image guidance levels.

caption: Figure 4: CLIP Cosine similarity score on ImageNet-LT computed between: (a) Synthetic image - original real images. (b) Synthetic image - defined text prompt.
description: The violin plot visualizes the cosine similarity scores between synthetic images and real images (a) and between synthetic images and text prompts (b) at different image guidance levels.

caption: Figure 12: Effect of Image Guidance (mixing syn+real). All-level experiments use the synthesis samples from all guidance scales selected for each task. 0.5 refers to only using synthetic data with guidance level λ = 0.5 for fine-tuning. Left: results on iWildCam. Right: results on ImageNet-LT
description: The chart displays the effect of various image guidance levels on the performance of the model for both iWildCam and ImageNet-LT datasets, comparing the results of using only one guidance level versus all guidance levels.
